title: Dot
content:
Hi there guys.

Can anyone identify this font? If so can it be purchased? If not are there any other similar font that can be purchased? Particularly the lighter weights?

Many thanks in advance.

Doj.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414190626im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DOT_5674.jpg)
author: doj

comments.content: You can find a series of suggestions for dotted typefaces here: [http://typophile.com/node/97219](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414190626/http:/typophile.com/node/97219 "http://typophile.com/node/97219")

This is **EE Nobblee (Light / Regular / Bold)** font by Miles Newlyn, used in "Everything Everywhere 4G network" rebrand [2012]:  
 [http://www.d4online.com/blog/2012/11/ee-rebrand](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414190626/http:/www.d4online.com/blog/2012/11/ee-rebrand "http://www.d4online.com/blog/2012/11/ee-rebrand")  
I don't know if this can be purchased...

[Rebranding of EE](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414190626/http:/www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/ee.php) by [Wolff Olins](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414190626/http:/www.wolffolins.com/work/26/ee) and 'Nobblee' typeface designed in collaboration with [Miles Newlyn](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414190626/http:/newlyn.com/) and exclusive for EE so definitely, not available to sell.  
Among Riccardo's great suggestions he's referring to, the best ones here are Raleway Dots, Codystar, Core Circus 2D Dot, Frontage Bulb and Perfograma.
